head.title: October 22-28; AT&T Decides to Split Into 4 Businesses

hedline.hl1: October 22-28; AT&T Decides to Split Into 4 Businesses

block.p: Hoping to buy all your communications services -- wireless, Internet, cable television, telephone -- from one company and pay one bill? Don't count on AT&T. The company announced it would break into four parts in AT&T's biggest overhaul since the Baby Bell local phone companies left the nest in 1984. Under C. Michael Armstrong, AT&T's chairman since 1997, the company had tried to build a ''one-stop shop'' for communications consumers. But investors failed to line up to buy into the strategy.

Hoping to buy all your communications services -- wireless, Internet, cable television, telephone -- from one company and pay one bill? Don't count on AT&T. The company announced it would break into four parts in AT&T's biggest overhaul since the Baby Bell local phone companies left the nest in 1984. Under C. Michael Armstrong, AT&T's chairman since 1997, the company had tried to build a ''one-stop shop'' for communications consumers. But investors failed to line up to buy into the strategy.
Over the next two years, people who now hold AT&T shares will end up with four stocks, one each for the company's consumer unit, wireless group, cable operation and business-services division.
